instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2828: What is 820-2828? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: iMac 27 2011 No power
threads.message:
Hello!

can you provide some guidance on how to check the PSU (614-0446)?

Thanks

threads.title: iMac 27 2011 No power
threads.message:
With the board disconnected I get 1.2V in one pin and 1V in another pin. 

With the board connected nothing.

threads.title: iMac 27 2011 No power
threads.message:
Can we know where???
Use MLB schematic for the power connector.

threads.title: iMac 27 2011 No power
threads.message:
I was able to get another PSU, now different issue:

MB: [B]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2828</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A[/B]
With graphics card installed: 
LED501: ON
LED502: JUST A LITTLE "SPARKLE" (DA UN DESTELLO Y SE APAGA)
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_MXM</SIGNAL>: 0.440V (DIODE MODE)
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>: 0.310V (DIODE MODE)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>: 0.353V (DIODE MODE)


With graphics card NOT installed: 
LED501: ON
LED502: ON
LED503: OFF
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_MXM</SIGNAL>: 0.450 (DIODE MODE)
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>: 0.314V (DIODE MODE)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>: 0.357V (DIODE MODE)
FANS KEEP ON

threads.title: iMac 27 2011 No power
threads.message:
Check starting in SMC bypass mode, with graphics card installed.

Should be good to test with known good MXM card.

threads.title: iMac 27 2011 No power
threads.message:
SMC Bypass same issue:
LED501: ON
LED502: JUST A LITTLE "SPARKLE" (DA UN DESTELLO Y SE APAGA) 

I will try to get anotherd card to test, in the meantime, is there anything else I could check?
